He does this as well by looking for opportunities to get discounts with his purchases in greater volume, which is what he expects to do with his credikiva, the first loan he is taking out from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

By means of the loan, he will buy in bulk: household supplies, snacks, soft drinks and groceries, benefitting from the purchase prices that his suppliers offer. He will be able to translate this into good performance for his business.

loans.use: To buy in greater volume, household supplies, snacks, soft drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Izatoy

texts.ru: Изатой трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она занимается предпринимательством. После того как её супруг остался без работы, она решила искать работу, так как дети ещё были маленькими, их надо было обучить, кормить и одевать, а для этого нужны деньги. Изатой с тех пор начала заниматься бизнесом купле- продажей женских тапочек и обуви, на полученный прибыль она выдала дочерей замуж. Мужа отправила на заработки в Российской Федерации. Изатой запрашивает займ для покупки товара с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Izatoi is a hardworking and kind woman. She is married and has three children. Izatoi is an entrepreneur. After her husband became unemployed, she decided to look for work. The children were still small, but they needed an education, and an education requires money. Since then, Izatoi has been selling women's slippers and shoes. With the income she earned, she covered the expenses of her daughter's wedding. Her husband has been sent to do seasonal work in the Russian Federation. Izatoi is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Gerturde

texts.en: Gerturde is 38 years-old. She wants the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Donath

texts.en: Donath is 41 years-old. He is married and has three children. With the loan, he wants to buy more clothes, a business he has been doing for the last ten years. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gunter Salvatore

texts.es:
GUNTER SALVATORE tiene 40 años de edad es divorciado tiene un hijo, vive solo en casa de unos familiares en guaranda provincia de Bolívar

GUNTER SALVATORE es cerrajero y soldador. Solicita el crédito para comprar barillas, soldadora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los materiales que le hacen falta para trabajar mejor.

Las compras lo harán en Guaranda. 
El sueño es poder incrementar el negocio. En el tiempo libre le gusta bailar y parcticar el deporte en especial alzar pesas.
texts.en:
Gunter Salvatore is 40, divorced, and has one child. He lives alone in a family home in Guaranda, Bolivar province.
He is a locksmith and a welder. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of rods and a soldering iron. This loan will help him to buy the materials that he needs in order to work better.
He will make his purchases in Guaranda.
His dream is to be able to expand his business. In his free time, he enjoys dancing and playing sports, especially weightlifting.

loans.use: to buy rods and a soldering iron.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime de 27 años es la propietaria de la Tienda ubicada en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, a orillas del mar, lugar donde vive con su cónyuge y  sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 4 años.  Jaime desde muy joven, trabajó como ayudante de una tienda de propiedad de un comerciante natural del interior del país;   de su anterior jefe y de las tareas diarias que desempeñaba,  recopiló toda su experiencia, para 4 años después convertirla en su propio emprendimiento en un populoso sector de calles destapadas. Jaime afirma que tiene la suficiente experiencia y sensibilidad social para ofrecer un buen servicio y acomodar a todos los clientes que son de escasos recursos, pues él vende desde un tomate hasta media barra de jabón. Adicionalmente a la venta de víveres  los fines de semana vende cervezas, aprovechando el potencial turístico de su municipio y por ello da curso libre a la música compartida y enciende un potente equipo de sonidos y ubica en su terraza, mesas y sillas plásticas. El comenta que “curiosamente los hombres mas pobres,  son los que mas consumen licor los fines de semana, de ahí se cumple su refrán: “No hay borracho pobre ni cobarde” Jaime aspira a ampliar su negocio como en la venta de víveres como la de licores, por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará víveres, carnes, abarrotes que le permitentener un capital de trabajo adicional con el cual comprar, mejorar el surtido y rotar mas rápidamente su mercancía, generando un poco mas de utilidades.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 27, owns a store located in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, on the shores of the sea. He lives with his wife and two children ages 2 and 4. At a very young age, Jaime started working as an assistant in a store owned by a merchant from the interior of the country. He gathered experience from his boss and his day-to-day work over four years. He then poured this experience into his own enterprise in a highly-populated sector with unpaved roads. Jaime says that he has enough experience and social understanding to offer a good service and accommodate customers who have scarce resources; he will sell just one tomato or a half bar of soap. On top of selling groceries, on the weekends he also sells beer, taking advantage of his municipality's tourist appeal. For this, he gives free rein for sharing music and turns on a powerful sound system, setting out plastic chairs and tables on his terrace. He says that "strangely, it is the poorest men who most consume liquor on the weekends; in keeping with the phrase, "No hay borracho pobre ni cobarde" ["There are no poor nor cowardly drunks"].
Jaime hopes to expand both his businesses. For this reason he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will purchase groceries, meat, and supplies, which will allow him to have an additional working capital with which to buy stock, improve his stock, and rotate his merchandise more rapidly. This will generate him a slightly higher income.

loans.use: to buy groceries, meat, and supplies.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru:
Саёхат добрая и трудолюбивая женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 10 лет она занимается купле -продажей кураги и переработкой абрикосового сада. В бизнесе занимается одна. Ежегодно покупает сада абрикосовых деревьев с г. Худжанда около 1,5  га. 
 Муж занимается предоставлением услугу плотника, имеет доход от этой услуги. Саёхат кредитуется в «Имон Интернешнл» несколько лет,  имеет хорошую репутация и отличную кредитную историю. 
Саёхат  хотела бы получить займ  в размере  2 000 долларов США  для  приобретения сада абрикосовых деревьев с целью  переработки абрикоса.
texts.en: Sayokhat is a kind and hardworking woman; she is married and has two children. For more than ten years she has been selling dried apricots and processing harvests from apricot orchards. She works alone. Each year she buys apricot trees and rents 1.5 hectares of orchard space from the city of Khudzhand. Her husband is a carpenter, and earns an income providing carpentry services. Sayokhat has received loans from IMON International for several years, and has a good reputation and an excellent credit history. Sayokhat would like to receive a loan in the amount of 2000 dollars to purchase an orchard's worth of apricot trees to grow and process apricots.

loans.use: To purchase an apricot harvest

loans.name: Miech

texts.en:
Miech is a local farmer from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He is 23 years-old and married with a loving young child. To earn a living and raise his family, Miech devotes his life to work at the rice field in order to ensure good growth of his crops. Also, Miech goes fishing and sells fish to local traders to generate additional income. Miech loves his family so he is very honest in his daily business activities. He aims to provide a better future to his child.

As of now, he is taking out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 in order to purchase an extra plot of farmland to expand his farming business. He has strong determination to work out his plans and hopes that he is able to obtain a better quality of life someday. He is very appreciative of the great support of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of farmland in order to expand his farming business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La sra. Reyna de 55 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, trabaja como domestica en Comercial Minerva desde hace mas de 10 años. Solicita el credito para invertirlos en culminar paredes de la parte trasera de su casa y reforzar vigas ya que estas se encuentran en mal estado.
texts.en: Reyna is 55 years old, single, and doesn't have any dependent children.  She has worked as a cleaner at Minerva Stores for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan to invest in finishing some walls at the back of her house and to strengthen some beams which are in a bad state of repair.

loans.use: to repair her walls

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 19 years to 25 years. He describes himself to be a determined man.

He operates a carpentry shop where he sells furniture such as chairs, wall units, stools, tables, etc. He has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs three staff members. His business is located in a fast residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan in order to buy timber. His business goal is to run a bigger workshop within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have expanded his business and built rental houses for accomodation provisions with the profit that will be generated.

loans.use: to buy more timber to use to make furniture.

loans.name: Kum

texts.en:
Kum is from Prey Chor district, where she raises her four children by cultivating rice crops to sell. She is now 42 years-old and a widow. The income generated from the farming business seems rarely enough to provide basic necessities for the entire family. So, being a responsible mother, Kum is involved in buying and selling recycled materials for additional income. She has been in the two businesses for many years. 

Now, Kum would like to acquire a loan of KHR 1,200,000 to use in her farming business. She will buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor costs. This loan will offer a great help to her family and allow her to further develop her current business. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she can increase her yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 34-year-old man, an IDP [internally displaced person] who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two sons. He is a farmer who has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits grace every table for the Azerbaijani family and also make fresh punch. Samir sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). His wife actively helps him to raise the crops. As his products are in high demand, Samir wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet the market demand. For this reason, he applied for a 1500 AZN loan. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his third loan and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers to produce more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years-old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap to resell and this will help David generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. David hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a single woman. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She has been involved in this business for five years and she employs one staff member. Her business is located in a fast growing area and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan in order to buy beauty products such as cosmetics, weaves and braids. Her business goal is to make her beauty saloon the most preferred saloon within her home town within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have expanded her beauty saloon and created job opportunities for people.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as weaves, braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hurmat's Group

texts.en:
Hurmat is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and efficient and performs her duties very well. Hurmat has given birth to three children. The eldest one works while her remaining children are getting their education. Her husband operates a donkey cart offering loading services to his clients.

Hurmat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy a new donkey cart and he will be able to provide better loading services to his clients and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a donkey cart for a loading business

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en:
Elxan is a 43 year-old man on a pension.  He is married with three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Elxan has more than 18 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to best look after cattle.

Elxan usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens for 5-6 months and resells them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings 120 AZN income per month. Milk and yogurt, as well as meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yogurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are present in everyday life.   

This is only one financial income in his family and this is not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved children. Elxan applied for a loan of 1500 AZN in order to purchase one milk cow and two cattle.  This will his sixth loan from AqroInvest and Elxan has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and two cattle.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is a petty trader. Some of the items she sells are tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantain and others. Akosua has been in this business for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She uses her income to help her husband pay for their children’s school fees. Akosua needs this loan to purchase vegetables and foodstuffs to sell. Akosua will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica sells used clothing in Eguafo near Elmina. She has done this for eight years. She is married to a farmer and has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay for the utility bills. Monica needs this loan to purchase more used clothing for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Monia will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Kpemahuton Group

texts.fr: KPEMAHUTON est un groupe de dix personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe. La représentante du groupe, Mahoutin Célestine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 60 ans. Mahoutin Célestine est mariée à un certain Innocent. Mahoutin Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Mahoutin Célestine vit seule avec ses  enfants. Mahoutin Célestine assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Mahoutin Célestine vend depuis une vingtaine d’année, des boissons et divers produits dans son quartier. Mahoutin Célestine s’approvisionne dans un dépôt du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Mahoutin Célestine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
KPEMAHUTON is a group of ten persons whose members belong to the same group. The group's representative, Mahoutin Célestine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 60 years old and married to a man named Innocent. Mahoutin Célestine did not attend school. The couple have four children, of whom some are in school. Two of the children remain in their care. 

Mahoutin Célestine lives alone with her children. She ensures by herself that the diverse household expenses are covered. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling beverages and various goods in her district for about twenty years. She gets her supplies from a warehouse in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, and aiming to expand her business, Mahoutin Célestine is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the group KPEMAHUTON. This loan will be used to respond further to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The previous loans have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to buy beverages and various products

loans.name: Fa-Nou Group

texts.fr: FA-NOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Adjoa Bénédicte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 26 ans et est célibataire. Adjoa Bénédicte vit seule et assure seule ses diverses charges. Depuis dix ans, Adjoa Bénédicte vend des fruits et des paires de chaussure, activité qu’elle exerce par le système de distribution et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Adjoa Bénédicte achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Adjoa Bénédicte et les autres membres du groupe FA-NOU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: "Fa-nou" is a group of three people who all live in the same area. The group leader, Adjoa Bénédicte (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 26 years old and unmarried. She lives alone and provides for herself. For ten years, Adjoa Bénédicte has sold fruit and pairs of shoes, a business she runs through the distribution system and which provides her with a significant income. She buys her goods at a market in Benin. This is the second time Adjoa Bénédicte and the other members of the Fa-nou group are seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of strengthening their working capital and their businesses, in order to better respond to the demands of their clientele. The previous loan was repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy shoes and fruit.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is a 31-year-old married man with four children. He is an IDP [internally displaced person] and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds sheep for meat and wool for local butchers. Elnur has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after sheep. He receives 120 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) of financial support from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover his family's needs. Elnur usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 4-5 months and resells them at a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Mutton is considered very healthy and is also present in everyday life. Wool is very useful for blankets and bed mattresses made by local woman. There is only one source of financial income in this family. Elnur applied for 800 AZN to purchase seven sheep and fodder.

loans.use: to buy seven sheep and fodder

loans.name: Gbevivi Group

texts.fr: GBEVIVI est un groupement de treize personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Félicienne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Félicienne a très peu fréquenté l’école. Félicienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Félicienne vend depuis près vingt ans, des céréales (maïs, soja) dans sa région. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Félicienne et les autres membres du groupe GBEVIVI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier prêt reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
GBEVIVI is a group of thirteen persons whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Félicienne (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 41 years old and married to a farmer named Pascal. The couple have four children, of whom some are in school. Two of the children remain in their care. 

Félicienne attended school very little. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

To help with the diverse household expenses, Félicienne has been selling grains (corn, soybeans) in her region for nearly twenty years. She gets her supplies from a region of Benin. 

This is the second time that Félicienne and the other members of the group GBEVIVI have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their business, as well as responding better to the requirements of their customers. The first loan received was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and soybeans

loans.name: Hamady

texts.fr: Hamady est un homme marié sans enfants.Il a en charge son épouse et ses deux parents.Il mène une activité de transport urbain avec une motocyclette.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins.Aujourd'hui il sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter une nouvelle motocyclette "Djakarta".Il ambitionne de constituer plus tard un parc de motos de transport.
texts.en: Hamady is a married man with no children. He provides for his wife and two parents. He runs an urban transport business with a motorcycle. This business provides him with a sufficiently consistent income that allows him to provide for himself and his family. Currently he is seeking a loan of 250,000 F to buy a new "Djakarta" motorcycle. In the future, he plans to establish a transport motorcycle park.

loans.use: To buy a new "Djakarta" motorcycle.

loans.name: Dagbegnikin 3 Group

texts.fr: DAGBEGNIKIN 3 est un groupement de quinze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Colette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Luc. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Colette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Colette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Colette vend des chaussures et des produits cosmétiques par le système de distribution. Parallèlement à cette activité, Colette vend des mèches. Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Colette et les autres membres du groupe DAGBEGNIKIN 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: "Dagbegnikin 3" is a group of 15 people who all live in the same area. The group leader, Colette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 41 years old and married to a man named Luc. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Colette had very little schooling. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple provide for the household together. For close to ten years, Colette has sold shoes and cosmetics through the distribution system. Alongside this activity, she sells hair extensions. Colette gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the first time Colette and the other "Dagbegnikin 3" group members are seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of strengthening their working capital and their businesses, in order to better respond to the needs of their clientele.

loans.use: To buy shoes and hair extensions.

loans.name: Association Femme Sengaz N°11 Group

texts.fr: L'Association femme sengaz n°11 est un groupe de solidarité composé de cinq femmes.Elles exercent toutes un commerce de produits ménagers tels que le savon, les ustensiles de cuisine, des verres, des tasses....Elles se cotisent chaque semaine pour constituer une épargne dans leur compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus qui leur permettent de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins ainsi qu'une bonne partie des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits ménagers.Leur ambition est d'ouvrir une grande boutique dans leur localité.
texts.en: The "Sengaz 11" women's association is a loan group comprising five women. They all run businesses selling household goods such as soap, cooking utensils, glasses, cups, etc. They join together each week to build up the savings in their account at UIMCEC. This business provides them with an income allowing them to provide for themselves and to take care of a good portion of their family's daily expenses. In order to strengthen their businesses, they are seeking a loan of 250,000 F to buy household products. Their ambition is to open a large store in their neighbourhood.

loans.use: To buy household products.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita produces kenkey [fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves] for sale. In front of Rita is the kenkey she is producing. She is married to a farmer and has 10 children. She uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of the family. Rita needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Rita will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for her kenkey [fermented corn dough]  production

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish monger from Eguafo near Elmina. She also cooks kenkey and fried fish for sale. Ama has been in this business for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Ama uses her income to help her husband pay for their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey and fish to fry for sale. With the new profit, Ama wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey [fermented corn dough] and fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Ndickou

texts.fr:
Madame Ndickou âgée de 36 ans, fait du commerce depuis 4 ans. Elle est mariée et loge un peu loin du guichet, seulement elle a été mis en rapport avec l’IMCEC  par un client membre fondateur  de ce guichet.  Elle est à son 1re crédit et aimerait  100000F CFA pour améliorer son commerce qui consiste à vendre des chaussures et  des sacs. Ndickou n’a pas de charges sinon personnelles liées à ses effets de toilettes. Si l’activité marche, elle aimerait diversifier  ses produits  en y associant des produits cosmétiques.
Ndickou est ambitieuse et a comme projet  futur d’acheter un terrain avec les bénéfices qu’elle a acquis.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndickou is 36 years old and has run a business for four years. She is married and lives a little far away from the local UIMCEC branch, but she was put in touch with the organization by a founding member client of the branch. She is on her first loan and would like 100,000 FCFA to improve her business, which consists of selling shoes and bags. Ndickou has no additional people to provide for apart from her own personal needs. If the business progresses, she would like to diversify her products by selling cosmetics.
Ndickou is ambitious and one of her future projects is to buy a plot of land with the profits she has made.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana has given birth to a son who is only a year old. Farzana is a very caring mother and takes care of her child very well. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers.

Farzana sews clothes. She is very skillful and has a lot of passion for her work. She continuously tries to learn new skills for the improvement of her work quality. She has applied for a loan to replace her sewing machine. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete client orders on time and increase her profits. She is an experienced person in her business and is confident that her business will further improve after investing the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maricela; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de carne de res,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia compra y vende su mercaderia en una de las ferias que se realiza los dias viernes,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas carne para su negocio.
                                                     
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maricela belongs to the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of Anta province in the department of Cusco.

Maricela wants to continue with her business of purchasing and selling beef.  She enjoys being in this business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  Maricela buys and sells beef in a street market that is held on Fridays.  She is a responsible woman who is eager to keep working for her family.

Maricela is asking for a loan in order to purchase more meat for her business.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.name: Gnonsou Maurice

texts.fr: Gnonsou Maurice est âgé de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Gnonsou Maurice n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Gnonsou Maurice est marié à un certain Mondoukpè. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont quatre constituent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Gnonsou Maurice vit ensemble ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Gnonsou Maurice vend des porcs et fait la transformation de noix de palme en vin de palme de façon secondaire. Gnonsou Maurice exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans dans sa région. Gnonsou Maurice s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Gnonsou Maurice contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Gnonsou Maurice sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Gnonsou Maurice is 42 years old and lives in Benin. He did not attend school. He is married to Mondoukpè. The couple support five children, of whom four are their own. All of the children are in school. Gnonsou Maurice lives together with his children and wife. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To meet the diverse household needs, Gnonsou Maurice sells pigs, and he processes palm nuts into palm wine on a secondary basis. He has been in this business for fifteen years in his region. He gets his supplies from a region in Benin. Thanks to the revenues that this business generates for him, he helps cover the different expenses at home. 

To meet the needs of his burgeoning customer base, Gnonsou Maurice is requesting for the first time a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом мужчина в возрасте 39 лет.Женат,имеет 2 детей.Он работает грузчиком в железнодорожной станции.А супруга его работает уборщицей в местной школе.Семья Илхома очень трудолюбивая.Они с женой стараются содержать семью в достатке.Несколько лет назад Илхом начал строить дом и в этом году он достроил его.Теперь хочет обустроить этот дом и на полученный кредит хочет приобрести строительные материалы. Он кредитуется с 2011 года,ни разу не нарушал политику кредитования.Он благодарен нашей организации и надеется на нашу поддержку.
texts.en: Ilhom is a 39 year old man and has two children.  He works as a freight handler at the railroad station.  His wife is a cleaning woman at the local school.  They are very hard working.  He and his wife are trying to provide well for their family.  This year he finished building a house that he started a few years ago.  Now, he would like to fit it out.  He wants to buy building materials with his loan.  He has been borrowing since 2011 and not once has he broken the terms of the loans.  He is grateful to our organization and is relying on your support.

loans.use: to fit out his house

loans.name: Imomali

texts.ru: Имомали проживает в районе Пяндж. Ему 33 года. У него 9 детей. Его жена занимается растениеводством. Сам он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Imomali lives in the Pyandj region.  He is 33 years old and he has 9 children.  His wife grows crops.  Imomali is a rancher.  He has been in this business for 10 years already.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a 44-year-old man and married with four children.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  Nariman has bred cattle and cows for the last 10 years. He is on pension,  which is too low to cover family needs. 

Nariman usually buys small calves, then raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them at a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN, and this business is the main source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Nariman also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

He wants to expand his business and improve the life conditions of his family. He has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase a milk cow, a head of cattle, and fodder.  This will be his 2nd loan from Aqroinvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow, a head of cattle, and fodder.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El sr. Juan de 45 años de edad, es acompañado, trabaja como Guarda de Seguridad para la Alcaldia. Solicita el credito para invertirlos en la construccion de un bajarete que le servira como cocina en su casa y asi contar con mayor comodidad, pues actualmente cuando llueve no puede hacerlo.  Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old and in a relationship. He works as a security guard for the mayor's office. 

Juan is requesting the loan to invest it in the construction of a covered patio that will serve as a kitchen in his house. That way they will be more comfortable; currently the patio can't be used for cooking when it rains. His greatest dream is to be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a covered patio that will serve as a kitchen.

loans.name: Yakhshigul

texts.ru: Яхшигул более пятнадцати лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж помогает ей в продвижении ее деятельности. Она берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Yakhshigul has been rearing livestock for more than 15 years.  She raises them at her home.  She is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband helps her in the advancement of her business. She is taking out a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Logala

texts.en:
Logala is a 50-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 19 years old.  

Logala runs a tailoring business and has been in business for 15 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotion by the loan officers and he is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more goods. In addition to this business, he benefited a lot from the previous loan by making many clothes and has built a house with part of the money.

In five years, he wants to open a manufacturing service. He hopes to employ more people.

His major challenge includes inflation in the market and high prices.
 
He is happy that Finance Sudan is giving him more loans.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items and materials.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda.  She is single and has four children, who are all currently in school.  For the past six years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big shop and get more profit. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq is friendly and hardworking man of 39. He is married and has two daughters.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  He breeds cattle and has 10 years of experience in this field.  Sadiq gets financial support from the government, but 100 AZN is too small an amount to cover his family's needs.
 
Cattle breeding requires a lot of physical activity and spending most of the time in the open air.  Pasturing takes 80% of Sadiq's time. He usually buys small calves and then raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN, and this business is the only source of income in his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

Sadiq would like to purchase more cattle, and for this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN.  He needs this loan to increase monthly turnover and cover the needs of customers.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ganados y luego los vende para que sus clientes que se dedican al negocio de venta de carne,la socia tambien vende carne,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Trinidad is continuing with her business of buying live cattle and selling them to customers who are in the meat-selling business.  She also sells meat herself.  Trinidad works from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM, and her business is how she supports her children.  Trinidad’s dream is to expand her cattle-selling business.  She is asking for a loan to purchase cattle.

Trinidad is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Zahide

texts.en:
Zahide is a 30-year-old woman and married with three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  She breeds cows and cattle and sells milk, milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers.  He also raises sheep for meat purposes. Zahide has more than eight years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her how to best look after cattle. Her husband works as a builder and receives a 80 AZN salary, which is too low to support her family.

Zahide usually buys small cattle and then raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them at profit in the local livestock bazaar.  She sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk and meat sales bring 140 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan.  People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and they always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered as very healthy and are also present in everyday life. 
  
This is the only financial income in her family and not enough to cover the basic needs of her beloved children.  Zahide has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase one head of cattle and one milk cow.

loans.use: to buy one head of cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta cooks banku to sell. She serves it with fried fish, pepper, and a tomato sauce in Eguafo, which is near Elmina. She is a widow and has three children.  Benedicta has been in this business for 20 years now.  As a single parent, she uses her income for the general upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to establish a better stall to sell her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku to sell

loans.name: Munis

texts.en:
Munis is a 24-year-old man. He is an IDP and lives with his parents in a Bilasuavr IDP Settlement. He breeds cattle and has five years of experience in this field.  Munis gets financial support from the government, but 100 AZN is too small of an amount to cover his family's needs. 

Cattle breeding requires a lot of physical activity, and he spends most of his time in the open air. Pasturing takes 80% of Munis' time. He usually buys small calves, raises them, fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them at a more profitable price at a livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 130 AZN, and this business is the only source of income for his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolmas. His father and grandfather help him to look after the livestock. 

Munis would like to purchase more cattle, and for this purpose, he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He will buy two cattle.

loans.use: To buy two cattle

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba produces fanti kenkey to sell in Eguafo, which is near Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.  Aba has been selling fanti kenkey for a few years now. She uses her income to support her husband and to pay for their children's school fees.  Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey to sell. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize for the production of fanti kenkey

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena Emperatriz; La socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan y en las ferias de los dias viernes,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas chanchos para su negocio.  
                                                    
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "RICHARY ANTEÑA" communal bank. The bank is located in the Anta district, which is part of the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

The member is Elena Emperatriz. She continues with her business of raising livestock, such as pigs. She has been in this business for years and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into it. Elena Emperatriz raises these young animals to later sell them to her customers upon request and in the Friday markets. She is a responsable person with a strong desire to continue working for her family.

Elena Emperatriz is requesting this loan to purchase more pigs for her business. She is happy about the loan and committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her business.

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Momar  est chauffeur dans une société de transport  en commun depuis 15 ans. Il est âgé de 54 ans, marié et père de famille. Il possède une maison qu’il est entrain de construire pour pouvoir abriter sa famille. Pour cela, il a besoin de l’appui de l’IMCEC  ou il vient solliciter pour la 1ère fois, un crédit de 500000F CFA pour acheter des fenêtres, des portes et   monter des balcons en aluminium. Momar s’occupe  de sa famille, de la nourriture et du payement des factures.
Son seul souci actuellement est d’achever la construction de sa maison et d’être stable concernant la location.
texts.en:
Mister Momar has been a driver for a public transportation company for 15 years. He is 54 years old, married, and a father. He owns a house which he is currently in the process of building, so as to be able to provide shelter for his family. To this end, he needs support from IMCEC, from which he requested a first loan of 500,000 XOF. With it, he will purchase doors and windows as well as get aluminum balconies built. Momar takes care of his family, providing food and paying the bills.
Currently, his only concern is to complete construction and to be in a stable situation vis-à-vis rental.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Alain Roger

texts.fr: Alain Roger est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 30 ans, fiancé et père de 04 enfants dont l'age varie 04 et 10 ans. En plus de ses enfants, il a également en charge sa petite soeur qui va à l'école tout comme ces derniers. comme activité, il a une boutique dans laquelle il vend en détail des produits alimentaires et les boissons hygiéniques. il a 30 mois d'expérience dans cette activité. Avec ce crédit, il voudrait renforcer son stock de marchandise tant du coté des boissons que des produits alimentaires pour pouvoir vendre également en gros auprès des détaillants, ce qui est génératrice d'un peu plus de revenus. il a pour ambition à terme de s'acheter un terrain afin de construire et de garantir la stabilité de sa famille
texts.en:
Alain Roger is a young man from Cameroon. Aged 30, he is engaged and a father of four children from four to ten years old. In addition to his children, he supports his younger sister, who also still attends school.
His business is a store in which he retails groceries and sanitary beverages. He has 30 months of experience in this business. With this loan, he would like to increase his stock of beverages as well as of groceries and be able to sell wholesale to retailers, which generates slightly higher profit.
In the long run, his ambition is to purchase some land on which to build in order to guarantee stability for his family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a 45-year-old man and married with three children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk, milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers.  He also raises sheep for meat purposes. Yusif has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him how to best look after cattle. He receives 120 AZN of financial support from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover family needs.

Yusif usually buys small cattle and then raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them at profit in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk and meat sales bring 250 AZN of income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma and they always use yoghurt sauce.  Milk products are considered very healthy and are present in everyday life. 
  
This is the only financial income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Yusif has applied for a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase three head of cattle, one milk cow, and fodder.  This will be his third loan, and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle, one milk cow, and fodder.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hairdresser at  Eguafo near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Nancy has been a hairdresser for three years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the accommodation bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, slippers and shoes for sale. With the new profit, Nancy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, slippers and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Georgena

texts.en:
Georgena is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. She makes and sells kenkey, which is made from maize (her packets of kenkey are next to her in the photo). She uses her income to help support her family.

Georgena is requesting a 1000 GHS loan from CRAN to buy additional bags of maize for her kenkey production. With greater profits she will expand production.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of maize.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a widow who lives with her three children in Eguafo near Elmina. For awhile now she has made and sold kenkey, an African dish made out of maize. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children.

Efua is requesting a 400 GHS loan from CRAN to buy more bags of maize for her kenkey sales. With greater profits Efua hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth is 28 years old, living in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three daughters, all of whom are still her responsibility and in school. She has been rice farming on one hectare of farmland and potato planting on 1.6 hectares of farmland for ten years to make a living. She can earn approximately KHR 31,700 per day from her current business.

Yeth has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back her past loans. She has used the loans from VisionFund successfully to better support her living. In order to support her family's business for a better living, she is applying for a new loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her business and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to increase her family's income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 50 years old, married and with three children. He operates a cereal shop and also has a posho mill within the shop. He describes his immediate business environment to be competitive with reliable customers. Previously, he was employed in the textile industry.

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save and keep track of his business because he has been trained in business management. He hopes to expand his business and create employment opportunities. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy five bags of maize and for transportation.

loans.use: To buy five bags of maize and transportation.

loans.name: Hongly's Group

texts.en:
Hongly, 44, is a married father of five children in a village of Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He still has three children who are dependents and two who work for others for pay and in a garment factory. To make a living, he and his wife plant spices as the primary source of the family’s income and sometimes they work for others for pay. 

This is the second loan for Hongly’s group of two members. Now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Hongly, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow his business and earn more income. He also has a plan to plant banana trees as another source of family income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is forty years old and divorced. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He breeds cows, cattle and sheep to sell to local butchers. He also sells milk and yogurt. Beef and mutton are a staple in Azerbaijan where they are used in everyday dishes such as pilau and dolmas along with a yogurt sauce.

Hamid has eight years of success with livestock, thanks to his father who taught him how best to look after cattle. He buys them young, fattens them up for five to six months and then resells them at a profit in the local livestock bazaar. He sells his milk and yogurt to his neighbors. His milk and meat sales bring in 120 AZN a month.

Hamid’s income is his family’s only source of income and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. He has applied for a 1500 AZN loan from Aqroinvest to buy two beef cattle, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two beef cattle, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Conectadas Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Conectadas al Futuro” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales  se encuentran; venta de cloro, venta de zapatillas, abarrotes, venta de comida, costuras, venta de ensaladas, repostería, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. 
Cecilia, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste chaqueta de color negro, en sus manos sostiene una  carpeta de Fondo Esperanza, usa una cadena de adorno en su cuello, su cabello es de color café oscuro, lo usa largo y suelto.
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida, específicamente sopaipillas, empanadas, entre otros productos. Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja sola y que ofrece sus productos a sus clientes en un carro que lo ubica frente de un consultorio. Ahí atiende de lunes a viernes desde las 7ºº hasta las 19ºº horas, ya que el fin de semana lo dedica a la familia.
La mercadería  e ingredientes que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente. Con el crédito comprará ingredientes, específicamente aceite, mostaza, kétchup, queso, jamón, para su negocio.
Una de sus metas son adquirir un vehículo para comprar y poder movilizar su carro a todas partes.
Cecilia vive junto a su marido quien se desempeña como maestro pintor, y 3 hijas, una de 17 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando enfermería,  y de 14 y 11 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando en el colegio. Sus sueños a nivel laboral  son comprar un vehículo y estabilizar su negocio para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, y a nivel personal terminar su casa.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Conectadas al Futuro" (Connected to the Future) consists of 16 entrepreneurs who engage in different trades such as selling bleach, selling slippers, selling groceries, selling food, sewing, selling salads, making pastries, providing services, and other activities. All of the members are from the city of Viña del Mar.

Cecilia, the president of the Communal Bank, is seen in the photo standing in the first row in the third position, going from right to left. She is wearing a black jacket and holding a Fondo Esperanza folder in her hands. In addition, she is wearing a necklace and has long dark brown hair.

Cecilia prepares food, specifically "sopaipillas" (fried dough, the Chilean version has squash mixed in), empanadas, and other products. She started this business two years ago. Cecilia says that she works alone and offers her products from a cart located in front of an office building. She manages her business Monday through Friday from 7am to 7pm. On the weekends, she spends time with her family. The supplies and ingredients that she needs are purchased at different supermarkets and from distributors at low cost, which is financially convenient for her. With her loan, she will purchase ingredients, specifically oil, mustard, ketchup, cheese, and ham for her business. One of her goals is to acquire a vehicle for shopping and moving her cart to different places.

Cecilia lives with her husband, who works as a master painter, and three daughters. One is 17 years old and studying nursing, and the others, ages 14 and 11, are in in school. Her dreams for her work are to buy a vehicle and stabilize her business so that she can provide her family a better quality of life. On a personal level, she would like to complete her house. Cecilia is pleased and appreciative of the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, which has allowed her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable in the presence of other entrepreneurs in her Communal Bank with whom she shares different activities and interests. They also provide her with a moment of distraction. With respect to the training classes conducted during the meetings, she has learned how to better manage her business.

Viña del Mar is a city and community located on the central coast of Chile. It is known as "the Garden City" because of the gardens and courtyards found in some of the older homes in the city. Viña del Mar is also considered to be the tourism capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oil, mustard, ketchup, cheese, and ham.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio de 30 años de edad, vive en Unión Libre, tiene 1 hijo  y vive en una aldea rural de Taulabe, Comayagua. 
Dionicio desde pequeño realiza actividades de cultivo de café con su familia,  es una persona muy trabajadora, actualmente tiene cultivado 1 manzana de café ya que la zona donde el vive es apta para este cultivo,  saca producción de café pergamino húmedo y lo vende en el mercado local, pero muchas veces llegan los compradores hasta su casa. Esta motivado con el cultivo ya que este producto tiene gran demanda en las cuales obtiene buenas ganancias.
 A solicitado este segundo préstamo de L.10, 000.00 para invertir en compra de fertilizante para el mantenimiento de la finca de café para mejorar su producción.
Su plan es hacer más viveros para seguir sembrando y aumentar el nivel de producción y así aumentar también sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. He lives in a rural neighborhood of Taulabe, Comayagua.

From a very young age, Dionicio has engaged in coffee-growing activities with his family. He is a hardworking individual who currently has one plot of land for growing coffee. The area where he lives is suitable for this crop. The coffee is produced in parchment, washed, and then sold at the local market. On many occasions, buyers will come to his house. The high demand of this product is what motivates him to grow this crop, which enables him to obtain good earnings.

Dionicio is requesting his second loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that he can invest in the purchase of fertilizer for maintaining his coffee farm and improving his production. His plan is to create more seedbeds so that he can continue planting and increasing his production level, which will result in more sales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 44 years old and married. She sells vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 12 years. Besides selling vegetables, she also does farming. Previously, she acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her grow her business. She hopes to own a permanent store and open another outlet in a different location in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Arianna Yolibeth

texts.es: La joven Arianna de  25 años de edad es originaria de Estelí, soltera, ella además de tener su titulo de ingeniería en sistemas se dedica al comercio, brinda el servicio de Cyber café en su comunidad desde hace 2 años, negocio en el que ha obtenido experiencia y total dominio. Inicio su actividad con ahorros que obtuvo de su trabajo en una clínica de la ciudad de Estelí, en el Cyber recibe el apoyo de su papa que le ayuda a atender a los clientes, ella se siente satisfecha con su negocio ya que es muy rentable, cuenta con clientes fijos y le genera ingresos diarios. Arianna siente la necesidad de  invertir en su negocio para cubrir la demanda de los clientes es por ese motivo que hoy en día solicita del crédito para comprar repuestos para sus computadoras como mouse, monitor, teclado, etc. Arianna estima que este préstamo será de ayuda ya que podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del Cyber y comprar mas computadoras para su negocio  con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Arianna is a single young woman who is 25 years of age and originally from Estelí. She also has a degree in systems engineering and has a business of providing Internet services from a cybercafé in her community for the past two years. This business has enabled her to obtain experience and expertise. Arianna started this business using the savings she obtained from her job at a clinic in the city of Estelí. At the cybercafé, her father helps out by attending to the customers. She is very satisfied with her business because it is very profitable. Arianna has established customers and is able to generate a daily income.

She feels the need to invest in her business in order to keep up with the demand from her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy computer accessories such as a mouse, monitor, keyboard, and other items. Arianna believes this loan will be helpful in providing better service to her customers. Her plans for the future are to expand her cybercafé and buy more computers for her business in hopes of generating more income so that she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories such as a mouse, monitor, keyboard, and other items.

loans.name: Diana Soraya

texts.es: Diana tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea de Baracoa Cortes. Diana tiene más de 8 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de venta de comida como pollo frito con tajadas, chuleta de cerdo, pasteles de pollo y de carne y venta de helados, refrescos y churros. Siempre le ha gustado el comercio anteriormente vendía ropa pero miro que el negocio de comida es más rentable. Esta solicitando 21,000.00 lempiras para invertir en la compra de insumos para elaborar comida y otros productos que le ayuden a mantener surtido el negocio y le genere más ganancia. Su meta es seguir trabajando para que su negocio crezca y en lo personal crecer como comerciante y tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Diana is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a neighborhood of Baracoa Cortes.

For more than eight years, she managed her own business of selling food such as fried chicken with plantains, pork chops, and chicken and beef turnovers. She also sells ice cream, soft drinks, and fried dough. Diana has always enjoyed the retail trade and previously sold clothes for a living, but she saw that the food business was more profitable.

She is requesting a loan of 21,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing food and other products. This will help maintain the inventory of her business and result in more earnings. Her goal is to continue working so that her business can grow. On a personal level, she hopes to develop as a businesswoman and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making her dishes as well as fried dough, ice cream, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Aida, elle est âgée de 28 ans et fait du petit commerce de produits cosmétiques depuis 1 an seulement. Elle a démarré avec l’appui de son mari qui lui a remis 50000 FCFA  comme capital de départ.  Elle vient solliciter auprès de l’IMCEC  un crédit de 100000 CFA pour acheter  du parfum, du lait pour le corps  et  de la pommade.
Aida n’a pas de charges ; c’est son mari qui gère la famille.
Elle souhaite dans l’avenir, ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques dans le quartier ou elle loge.
texts.en:
Our borrower is named Aida; she is 28 years old and has been running a small business selling cosmetics for just one year. She began with the support of her husband, who gave her 50,000 CFA francs as start-up capital. She has just sought a loan of 100,000 CFA francs from UIMCEC in order to purchase perfume, body lotion, and pomade.

Aida does not have any dependents; it is her husband who manages the family.

In the future, Aida hopes to open a boutique selling cosmetics in the neighborhood where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Rosalio se desempeña como responsable de Radiologia del Hospital del municipio desde hace 24 años,  es soltero, solo una hija depende economicamente de el, Rosalio se caracteriza por ser muy responsables con sus deberes y muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos.  Solicita su Credito para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda como es arreglo de la cocina  ubicada en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, su sueño en la vida es gozar de salud , trabajo y mejorar sus condiones de vida para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalio has been in charge of the radiology department at the municipal hospital for the past 24 years. He is single and has a daughter who is financially dependent on him. Rosalio is known for being very responsible with his obligations and is highly respected by his co-workers and neighbors.

He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in improvements to his home, such as renovating the kitchen. His home is located in District #2 of Nueva Guinea. Rosalio's dream in life is to enjoy good health, continue working, and improve the living conditions that will help his family.

loans.use: to continue the renovations to his kitchen.

loans.name: Ugpr N°2 Takku Liggey Same Group

texts.fr: L'UGPR N°2 Takku liggey same est un groupe de cinq femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce de tissus et de produits de mercerie.Elles se réunissent chaque samedi pour effectuer des remboursement de leur crédit revolving et épargner.Elle parviennent à générer des revenus qui leur permettent de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à certains besoins de leurs familles.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des tissus et des produits de mercerie.
texts.en:
The Ugpr N°2 Takku Liggey Same Group is made up of five women who participate in the sale of fabric and notions [buttons, thread, etc.]. They get together each Saturday to complete the repayment of their revolving loan and to save. They manage to generate enough income to allow them to take care of themselves and to meet some of the needs of their families.

In order to strengthen their business, they are seeking a loan of 250,000 francs to purchase fabric and notions.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and notions [buttons, thread, etc.].

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and has three children aged 18, 20, and 23. She operates a retail shop to earn a living and has one employee. She describes her business environment to be good. She has been in the business for five years. Aside from that she does livestock farming.

She hopes to enlarge her business and distribute her goods in different locations in five years. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin is 42 years old, married, and is responsible for six children. She operates a rice farming business, which allows her to cover her daily expenses and support her children in their education. Chin is happy because she has a supportive husband who always helps her in the business. Also, he works in the construction field to provide the family income. She has been in the farming business for nearly 30 years. 

She is now taking out a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a motorcycle for household use. This is her first loan from HKL and Kiva, and she hopes that she can improve her living standards and make the family more comfortable. In the future, she wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr:
Samba est un jeune commerçant de 38 ans qui gère une boutique  dans le quartier. Il exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans. Il loge à environ 100m du guichet ce qui lui permet de faire régulièrement des transactions d’épargne. Samba  sollicite un crédit de 200000F CFA pour acheter  15 sacs de riz et un fut d’huile. I l s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne, des factures d’eau et d’électricité.
Samba est  ambitieux car il souhaite acheter une maison pour y installer sa famille.
texts.en:
Samba is a young merchant, 38 years old, who runs a shop in his neighborhood. He has been running this business for six years. He lives about 100 meters from an ATM, which allows him to deposit his savings regularly. Samba is seeking a loan of 200,000 CFA francs in order to purchase 15 sacks of rice and a cask of oil.

Samba takes care of the daily expenses, and the water and electricity bills. He is ambitious, because he hopes to purchase a house in which his family can live.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs (rice, oil, etc.) for his shop to sell.

loans.name: Mame Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Fatou est une dame de 56 ans qui s’active  dans le commerce depuis plusieurs  années. Elle est mariée et mère de famille .Elle est à son 2èmepret et sollicite un crédit de 100.000F CFA, qui va lui servir à achever quelques travaux de construction pour sa salle de bain.
Elle n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent et c’est avec  les bénéfices de son activité qu’elle a réussi à démarrer la construction de sa maison jusqu’à maintenant. Sa seule préoccupation actuelle est de finir  ce qu’il a entamé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Fatou is a 56-year-old woman who has been participating in business for several years. She is married and the mother of a family. She is on her second loan and is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to complete some construction work on her bathroom.

Mrs. Mame Fatou has no dependents to encumber her and it is with the profits from her business that she was able to begin the construction of her house. Her only concern at the moment is to finish what has been started.

loans.use: To do construction work on her bathroom.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
MARIA VICTORIA tiene 43 años, es soltera tiene 3 hijos de 13,10 y 8 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, esta conformada por 14 socios casi a 25 minutos de la oficina de San Simón, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

 MARIA VICTORIA se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, así como también el cultivo de papas. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, cerdos.

Con el apoyo del  crédito podrá guardar el capital que tenía para poder trabajar con el dinero del crédito.

Realiza sus compras y ventas cada quince días en la ciudad de Guaranda.
El sueño de la señora es comprar su propio vehículo con el fin de tener una mejor comodidad.
El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es el transporte.
En su tiempo libre descansa y disfruta del carnaval cuando son las épocas
texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 43 years old, single, and has three children (ages 13, 10, and 8). She lives with her children in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank "Tagma Rumiñahui" consists of 14 members and is located almost 25 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office in San Simón. The members engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Maria Victoria raises and sells chickens and also grows potatoes. She is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens and pigs. With the support of this loan, she will be able to preserve her capital and put the money from the loan to work instead. She buys and sells every 15 days in the city of Guaranda. Her dream is to buy her own vehicle so that she can get around more comfortably. The challenge she faces at the moment is the lack of transportation.

In her free time, Maria Victoria relaxes and enjoys Carnival whenever it is in season.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 24-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be courageous, humble, honest and a trustworthy man. He has been involved in this retail shop business for one year and employs two staff members. His business is located in a strategic area, and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of home products. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy home products and pay for the expansion of the business premises. His business goal is to run another retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had the best and most preferred retail shops.

loans.use: to buy home products and pay for the expansion of the business premises.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
C’est dans le souci de rendre son atelier plus attractif qu’Ibrahima, un jeune couturier âgé de 38 ans, a fait appel à une institution financière comme l’IMCEC pour y emprunter une somme de 300000 CFA. Ibrahima est  un habitué du guichet  car il est à son 6ème prêt. Il possède plusieurs machines mais pour cette fois ci, il veut acquérir une cornière pour ne pas avoir à renvoyer  certains  clients qui font cette commande.
Comme charges : il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et de la location de son atelier. Avec les crédits qu’il prend il peut diversifier les produits et services et élargir le nombre des employés.
Comme projet futur, il  envisage d’agrandir son espace commercial.
texts.en:
It's with the goal of making his studio more attractive that Ibrahima, a young, 38-year-old designer, has called upon a financial institution such as UIMCEC to borrow the sum of 300,000 CFA francs. Ibrahima is familiar with the institution, as he is on his sixth loan. He owns several sewing machines, but for this loan he would like to purchase an angle stitcher, so that he won't have to turn away certain customers who request this service.

As for expenses, he takes care of the daily expenses and the rent for his studio. With the loans he takes, he can vary his wares and services and expand the number of his employees.

As a future project, Ibrahima plans to expand his commercial space.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for his operation.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen still owns a boutique, it's 12 years now since she started the business and she earns a monthly income of KES 21,200. 

She has requested a third loan of KES 40,000 to purchase additional clothes for her business. She will plough back the profit earned into her business. 

Her dream is to see her her business expand and to have all her children educated.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
