Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, quinto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un enfriador, para aumentar la venta de cervezas y refrescos que le dejan un importante volumen de utilidades y es un negocio de contado. Con sus anteriores créditos ha logrado el crecimiento de su negocio, reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas, que le han reportado mayores ingresos, para continuar avanzando en el aumento del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Paola is 30 years old and works in her sales business in order to support her household.  She sells electrical appliances, cosmetics and clothing on credit.  She also sells drinks such as soda and beer for cash.  When she was 19 years old, Paola finished her high school education, brought up by her parents who are very hard-working people with good habits.  When her husband gave her some start-up capital, she was able to make use of these personal values to start up and manage a sales business.

Paola was married at 21 and is the mother of two children who are 2 and 7 years old.  She dreams of helping her children become successful people and so she takes care to educate them and work hard so that she can teach them the same values that her parents taught her.  Paola started her business four years ago and she has gradually attracted a number of regular customers who, in turn, refer her to new customers.  For this reason, the working capital she has with which to buy goods and respond to demand has become insufficient and she must wait to recover the money she is owed for her goods before she buys more.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan (her fifth loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use the money to buy a chiller cabinet so that she can increase her sales of beer and soft drinks which makes her very good profits and is a cash-based business.  With her previous loans, Paola managed to increase her business.  This is reflected in her increase in sales which has made her more income and enabled her to continue making progress in improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a chiller cabinet

loans.name: Nestor Ivan

texts.es:
Nestor Ivan tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Nestor  se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de cacao , además se dedica a la cría de animales cómo pollos y cerdos.  

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar pollos y cerdos. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder aumentar los animales criarlos y poderlos vender a un buen precio.

Los desafíos que se le presenta es la competencia y la plaga. El sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande de cría de animales.

En los tiempos libres le gusta cuidar a los animales.
texts.en:
Nestor Ivan is 20 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  

He is a member of the Cevallos community bank, located in Recinto San Francisco that is part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish in Ventanas.  The group members work as cacao farmers.  

Nestor works as a farmer planting cacao, and also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  He is asking for this loan to purchase chickens and pigs.  The loan would help him increase the number of animals he raises, so that he can sell them for a good price.  He faces challenges such as competition and pests.  

His dream is to have a larger business raising animals.  In his free time, he likes to take care of animals.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 34 years old, married, the father of four children and the caretaker of two relatives. 

Jean Baptiste sells various beverages such as local drinks, Fanta and water. He has 5 years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. His business hours are from 7 a.m to 8 p.m every day except Sunday. 

Jean Baptiste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various beverages such as local drinks, Fanta and water for resell. With the profit, he will be able to save money for his future, pay school fees for his children and renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy various beverages such as local drinks, Fanta and water for resell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a self-declared decoration fanatic. After she got divorced, Ana and her daughter moved to Orlando where she opened her own window treatment business, My Blinds Today. 

She specializes in providing clients with fine quality window coverings at deeply discounted prices. She is an energetic saleswoman and if she stands in front of a window she will immediately try and sell you the best blind. Technically, she is in charge of client visits, design drawings and order placement, but don't be surprised if she is also helping the contractor with the final installation. 

Ana will use this loan to buy an industrial table which will enable her to cut the blinds herself and increase her profit margin on each project. With this cutting table, she will be able to get better prices on fabric and finalize orders in her house. As her business continues to grow, Ana continues to masterfully juggle the demands of work and single-parenting.

loans.use: purchase an industrial table to cut blinds

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique, an expert furniture maker, has specialized in cabinets, book cases and office furniture for over ten years now. He is truly as master with wood and utilizes his carpentry skills to build doors and floors for his customers. He has a storefront location in Florida with a shop where he produces all his original pieces. 

His business has expanded since its early days of operation and he now employs two people on a project basis. Enrique, however, has very outdated equipment which has dramatically slowed down his production and limited the types of pieces he can produce. With the purchase of a new table saw, compressor and edge banding machine he will be able to increase his work capacity and expand his repertoire. 

He originally opened his business because he had a strong desire to be self-employed. His success has allowed him to support his wife and children, and send money home to Nicaragua to support his extended family there. He hopes that in the future these machines will enable him to take on new and exciting projects, and allow him to continue to employ people and contribute to his Florida community.

loans.use: to purchase a table saw, compressor and edge banding machine

loans.name: Mery Carolina

texts.es:
La socia Mery continua con su negocio de multi servicios ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia su negocio,la socia vende productos de libreria,internet y productos de belleza,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como perfumes y colonias.
texts.en:
Mery continues working in her multi-service business.  She has been in this business for years and it is doing well thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  every day.  Mery sells stationery products, provides Internet services and sells beauty products.  She is a cheerful and responsible person who has a great desire to continue making progress for the sake of her family.

Mery is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business (perfume and cologne).

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business such as perfume and cologne

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah lives in the Coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a clothing store, which has been operating for two years. She started the business through a loan from her sister. Her main business challenge is the lack of on time payments by some customers. Despite this, Ednah is determined to grow the business and be in a position to open other stores in the future. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is requesting a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes. The additional income from this loan will help her restock the shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: C18540 Urugwiro Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 56 years old, married, the mother of two children between 14 years and 17 years old and the caretaker of one 12-year-old relative. 

Vestine is a leader of a group called "C18540 URUGWIRO" in the local language. In the photo, she's the one sitting in front of the others. She works from 7 a.m to 9 p.m daily except on Sunday. She sells various goods such as bananas, beans, potatoes and maize; Vestine has 15 years of experience in this work and she currently employs one person to help her.

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various food items such as beans, potatoes and bananas for resell. With the profits, she will be able to save money for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as bananas, beans, potatoes, maize for resell.

loans.name: Marilyn Atenas

texts.es:
Marilyn es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha en casa de sus padres con su pequeño hijo de un año, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias hace las veces de padre y madre para su pequeño ya que es madre soltera;  a pesar de su corta edad ella siempre ha sido muy trabajadora, empeñosa y entusiasta; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y la necesidad de solventar sus gastos tuvo que dejar sus estudios universitarios de Economía, pero sueña con poder retomarlos muy pronto; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a su gran deseo de superarse y salir adelante, Marilyn trabaja como operadora de maquinas en un tragamonedas de su ciudad donde labora un aproximado de 9 horas diarias, ella se siente a gusta en su trabajo ya que la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Marilyn se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la puesta en marcha de su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa por pedidos, con la ayuda podrá comprar la mercadería necesaria, tales como: polos, chompas, pantalones, buzos, entre otros; de esta manera Marylin espera poder contar con más ingresos económicos, los cuales desea poder utilizar para terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble y así poder asegurar el bienestar y futuro de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 21 years old and lives in the city of Chincha in her parent's house with her one year old son.  Unfortunately, due to various circumstances, she has to be both father and mother for her son since she is a single mother.  Despite her young age, she has always been very hardworking, enterprising, and enthusiastic.  Due to a lack of financial resources and the need to meet her expenses, she had to leave her university studies in Economics, but she hopes to restart them soon.  In her free time, she likes to relax and listen to music and sometimes cooks a rich carapulcra (meat and potato stew) to share with her family.

Thanks to the support of her parents and her desire to excel and succeed, Marilyn works as a slot machine operator in her city about nine hours a day.  She likes this work since she is well regarded for her good performance and her friendliness towards people.  

Marilyn is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to launch her small business selling clothing.  With the help of this loan, she will purchase the necessary merchandise, such as polo shirts, sweaters, pants, sportswear, and other items.  Marilyn hopes that this business will provide more income, which she can use to finish building her house with good materials, and assure the well-being and future of her small son.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as polo shirts, sweaters, pants, and sportswear.

loans.name: Jesus Deliva

texts.es:
Jesús Deliva tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Jesús Deliva se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de cerdos, pollos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para seguir criando. Realiza sus compras en Babahoyo y ventas en la ciudad de Ventanas y San Juan.

El sueño es tener un negocio mas grande. El desafío al que se enfrenta es dificultades por el dinero.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jesús Deliva is 58 years old. She is single and she lives in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The Cevallos community bank is located in the recinto San Francisco in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. They work in agriculture.

Jesús Deliva raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs and chickens. 

With the support of the loan, she will be able to purchase more animals in order to continue raising them. She makes her purchases in Babahoyo and makes sales in the cities of Ventanas and San Juan. 

Her dream is to have a bigger business. The challenge she faces is difficulties with money.

In her free time, she focuses on her animal and her home.

loans.use: purchase pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fish monger at Eguafo near Elmina. She buys fish from the market and then fries them for sale. Esi has been in this business for 15 years now. She is married to a farmer and has six children. Esi uses her income to help her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more fish to fry and then sell. With the new profit, Esi wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry and then sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa desde que recibió su anterior credikiva, está muy contenta porque invirtió en artículos de plata, fantasía, jeans y mercancía variada como suéteres, calzado etc. Con ello ha logrado nuevos ingresos y también está invirtiendo en otro negocio de venta de cárnicos, en el que le está yendo muy bien; para poder responder a su clientela de estos últimos productos y tener exactamente lo que sus clientes necesitan, debe esperar a recoger su cartera de cuentas por cobrar de su mercancia,  para invertir en su otro negocio . Por eso nuevamente acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará productos cárnicos principalmente y algunas mercancías que han solicitado sus clientes, como artículos de plata y oro golfi. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Le doy Gracias a Kiva por esa labor que está haciendo: la de prestarle a personas de escasos recursos económicos, para tener una entrada mas, para mejorar la calidad de vida y seguir prosperando en el negocio”
texts.en: Rosa has been very happy since she received her previous Kiva loan because she invested it in silver jewelry, costume jewelry, jeans and a variety of other merchandise such as sweaters, shoes, etc.  This made her new income and she is also now investing in a new business selling meat products which is doing very well.  In order to meet her customer demand for these products and to have in stock exactly what her customers need, she must wait to collect money on her outstanding accounts in order to invest in this other business.  For this reason, she is applying for a new Kiva loan which she will mainly use to buy meat products and some other merchandise that her customers have requested such as silver- and gold-plated jewelry.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "I would like to thank Kiva for the work that they are doing: lending to people with limited financial means so that they can have another income with which to improve their quality of life and continue to thrive in their business".

loans.use: to buy meat products and other merchandise that her customers have requested such as silver- and gold-plated jewelry

loans.name: Irma Eloisa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Irma; La socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion de tamales hechos a base de maiz,la socia vende los tamales de forma ambulatoria para todos sus clientes que le solicitan , a la vez continua con su negocio de compra y venta de madera,la socia es una persona bien empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas madera para su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma continues her business making corn tamales.  She sells them on the street to all of her customers who request them.  At the same time, she continues with her business buying and selling wood.  Irma is an enterprising person who wants to continue working for her family.  

Irma is requesting this loan to purchase more wood for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for her business.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana Elizabeth tiene veintiún años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Diana Elizabeth se dedica a la agriculturaa la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales cómo pollos y cerdos.

Con el apoyo del crédito va a comprar mas animales para criar y luego venderlos a un buen precio. Realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Babahoyo y ventas en la ciudad de San Juan y en Ventanas.

El sueño de la señora es agrandar el negocio.El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es la falta de dinero para poder comprar los animales.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a su hogar.
texts.en:
Diana Elizabeth is 21 years old, single and has three children.  She lives with her children in Ventanas canton, in los Ríos province.

The Cevallos community bank is located in San Francisco, in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish.  The members of this community bank work in agriculture.

Diana Elizabeth's business is raising animals such as hens and pigs.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and pigs.

With the support of this loan, she will buy more animals to raise and then sell at a good price.  She makes her purchases in the town of Babahoyo and makes her sales in San Juan and Ventanas.

Diana Elizabeth's dream is to expand her business.  The difficulty she faces is a lack of money with which to buy animals.

In her free time, Diana Elizabeth takes care of her animals and her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 40 bags of rice and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maria; La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de quesos,moraya y papa,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas quesos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria continues in her business buying and selling cheese, 'moraya' (a freeze-dried potato product) and potatoes.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.  Maria is a responsible and determined person who has a great desire to continue working for the sake of her family.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy more cheese for her business.

loans.use: to buy more cheese for her business

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Osman.  He is married and has three children aged 25, 17, and 6. He has two additional dependents who live with him and also supports their schooling.  In 1989, Osman established his junk business. He began his business immediately after he completed his fifth form, and his parents did not have money to support him in furthering his education. Therefore, he decided to assist his friends in business until the time when he got some capital to establish his own business. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 Sierra Leone leone (SLL) every month. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Osman has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 10 bales of used clothing at 450,000 SLL and the balance will be used for transportation.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,000,000 SLL. In the future, Osman plans to establish his business in the provinces. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 bales of used clothing at 450,000 SLL.

loans.name: Rosaira

texts.es: Rosaira con su anterior credikiva compró muchos articulos variados y respondió a los pedidos de su clientela, ella vendió vestuario femenio, ropa para hombre, productos de belleza y mercancias que en sus catalogos ofrecieron con descuentos especiales. Su negocio logró mayor movilidad en sus inventarios y en sus cuentas por cobrar,  porque estas últimas aumentaron. En la actualidad necesita invertir aun mas en su negocio, para agregar un nuevo capital de trabajo y poder comprar articulos de tocador, accesorios femeninos, colonias, articulos de aseo, que le ayudan a rotar sus ventas rapidamente. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Quiero agradecerle por el apoyo recibido de Kiva, porque gracias a ellos he podido incrementar el capital y sacar mi negocio adelante. "
texts.en: Rosaira used her previous Kiva loan to buy a lot of different goods and she was able to fill her customers' orders.  She sold ladies' clothing, men's clothing, beauty products and merchandise which was available in her catalogs at special discounts.  She managed to improve her stock turnover and increase her accounts receivable.  She currently needs to invest even further in her business, adding new working capital so that she can buy personal care products, women's accessories, colognes and toiletries.  This will help her to achieve a quick sales turnover.  Her message to Kiva lenders is as follows: I would like to thank you for the support I have received from Kiva.  Thanks to you, I have been able to increase my capital and make progress in my business".

loans.use: to buy personal care products, women's accessories, colognes and toiletries

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Violeta y tiene 61 años de edad, es viuda es madre de un hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 16 años y es profesora jubilada, ella tiene su propio restaurante donde se vende platos típicos del Perú, también tiene un negocio donde se vende gas.  En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú, Margarita con todo su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido construir el segundo piso de su casa. Su sueño para el futuro es construir otra casa para  que la pueda alquilar. En todo este tiempo lo que mas ha aprendido es a ahorrar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de gas para vender en su negocio.
texts.en: Margarita is a member of the Violeta community bank.  She is 61 years old, a widow and has one son.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 16 years and is a retired teacher.  She owns her own restaurant where she sells traditional Peruvian dishes.  She also has a business selling gas.  During her years as a FINCA Peru member, Margarita has worked hard and managed to add a second storey to her house.  Her dream for the future is to build another house that she can rent out.  Over all these years, what Margarita has learned the most is how to save.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying gas to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy gas to sell in her business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena produces kenkey (a fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) for sale. Pictured in front of Abena are the leaves she uses in covering the maize dough, which is used to make the kenkey. She is married to a farmer and has nine children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the expenses of the family. 

Abena needs this loan to purchase bags of maize and leaves for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Abena will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and leaves for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila es socia del Bancomunal El Roble, tiene 57 años de edad y es madre 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 13 años y se dedica a la venta de hojas de coca para elaborar productos medicinales. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ha aprendido a ser puntual y le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que  aprendió muchas cosas que son innovadoras para su desarrollo personal y también para su negocio. Ella agradece los préstamos que le brindaron ya que con ellos mejoró su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hojas de coca para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en: Cirila is a member of the El Roble communal bank. She is 57 years old and she is the mother of one son. She has been a member FINCA Perú for 13 years. She sells coca leaves used for making medicinal products. She says that in all the time that she has been a FINCA Perú member she has learned to be punctual. She likes the training she receives at her communal bank since she has learned many things that are innovative for her personal development as well as her business’ development. She is grateful for the provided loans since they improve her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of coca leaves to sell in her business.

loans.use: purchase coca leaves to sell in her business

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Luz Eliana; La socia continua con su negocio de elaboración de pan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria vendiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de pan como manteca y harina.
texts.en:
Luz Eliana continues in her business making bread.  She has been in this business for years and it is doing well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.  Luz Eliana works as an itinerant vendor, selling her merchandise to customers who request it.  She is a cheerful and responsible person who has a great desire to make progress for the sake of her family.

Luz Eliana is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making her bread such as butter and flour.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread such as butter and flour

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cassava and palm fruits at Asafora near Cape Coast, which she has done for 13 years now. She is a widow and has four children.  She uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay her children’s school fees. Efua will uses her loan to purchase more palm fruits and food stuffs to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits and food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells cooking utensils and saucepans at Safora near Cape Coast.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling home products for some years now. With her income, she supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells maize at Asafora near Cape Coast, which she has done for four years now.  She is married and has two children. Ekua uses her income to support her husband in feeding the family and paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua wants to cultivate the maize she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to  sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives with her husband and three children in Asafora  near Cape Coast. She has sold maize for 10 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility and housing costs. Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua wants to cultivate her own maize to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a single parent with four children. For the past 21 years, she has been selling soap and rice at Asafora, near Cape Coast. As a single parent, Esi uses her income to feed and clothe her children as well as pay their school fees. 

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to sell. With her new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es: María es socia del Bancomunal Llamkasum y tiene 82 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 6 hijos (cuatro mujeres y dos varones). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 16 años y  es dueña de su propia tienda donde se vende abarrotes. Ella dice que su experiencia en FINCA Perú ha sido muy buena, tiene sus ahorros y su meta es siempre aumentarlos y la institución le ha ayudado a progresar. Su sueño para el futuro es continuar ahorrando para el resto de su vida. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, menestras.
texts.en: María is a member of the Llamkasum community bank.  She is 82 years old, married and the mother of 6 children (four daughters and two sons).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 16 years and owns her own store where she sells groceries.  She says that her experience with FINCA Peru has been very good.  She has savings and her goal is to always increase them.  The institution has helped her to make progress.  María's dream for the future is to continue saving for the rest of her life.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles and mixed vegetables.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market, smokes them and then sells them. Ekua has been selling smoked fish for 10 years now. She is married with three children. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase fresh  fish to smoke and sell. She plans to use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Elizabeta

texts.en:
Elizabeta is a 25-year-old Roma woman from the Romani ethnic community of Northern Albania. She is married and has two children who are 1 1/2 and 5 years old. She has been selling used clothes, different accessories and kitchenware items for the past four years. Elizabeta and her family live in a barrack with metal sheet roofing and cardboard on the floor without a toilet or running water. Many Roma still live in such conditions in Albania and you would wonder how they survive.
Elizabeta is applying for a Kiva loan through VisionFund Albania to buy more used clothes inventory in order to increase her sales. This is her second loan. She successfully paid off her previous loan. With any profits that she will be able to save, Elizabeta will build a little house to live a normal life.
She is very appreciative for the opportunity she has been granted, because this loan will really be a great help to her and most importantly to her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and accessories and houseware items to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua produces fanti kenkey (fermented maize dough wrapped in banana leaves) for sale in Asafora near Cape Coast. Pictured in front of Ekua is the maize dough she uses in producing her kenkey.  She is married and has nine children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling fanti kenkey for 20 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for the production of her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married with three children. For the past four years, she has been a fish monger, buying fresh fish from the market to smoke and sell. Efua uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. 

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells maize and cassava at Asafora near Cape Coast. She has done so for three years now.  Ama is married and has four children. She uses her income to help her husband feed the family and pay their children’s school fees.  Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and cassava to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ama wants to cultivate the maize and cassava she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fishmonger and also sells cooking utensils and saucepans at Safora, near Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Ekua has been selling these items for some years now.  She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Ekua will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica Isabel tiene 32 años vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de ocho años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS. 

Mónica Isabel  se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de animales cómo pollos, cerdos, patos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para críarlos y poder venderlos a un buen precio.

Realiza sus compras en Babahoyo, vende en San Juan, Ventanas y Babahoyo.

El sueño de la señora es comprar más animales y que el negocio cresca. El desafío al que se enfrenta es la dcompetencia.
En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Mónica Isabel is 32 years old. She is  in a common-law relationship. She has a son. She lives with her husband and her eight year old son in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. 

The Cevallos community bank is located in the recinto San Francisco in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. They work in agriculture.

Mónica Isabel raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase animals like chickens, pigs and ducks. 

With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase more animals in order to raise them and sell them at a good price.

She makes her purchases in Babahoyo. She sells in San Juan, Ventanas y Babahoyo.

Her dreams are to purchase more animals and for her business to grow. The challenge she faces is competition. 
In her free time, she focuses on her animals and cleaning her house.

loans.use: purchase animals like chickens, pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 39-year-old married woman with three children whose ages range from seven to 16. For the past two years, she has operated a store where she sells shoes. Florence describes herself as a visionary, aggressive, and determined woman. Her business is located in an ideal business location and her primary customers are local residents. Her major biggest business challenge is having insufficient funds to improve her business. 

Florence is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to open many more retail shoe stores within five years. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to import shoes from outside the country.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them to sell.  Esi has been selling fried fish for five years now. She is married and has five children.  Esi uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell. Esi will expand her business with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married with five children. For the past 11 years, she has been operating a chop bar, a cafe where she prepares and sells a variety of African dishes. She is seen scooping soup from a pot to serve her customers. Araba makes fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. She uses her income to support her husband and pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as maize, cassava, meat, fish, and other items to prepare food for sale. She plans to open a restaurant with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with five children. For the past five years, she has been buying fresh fish from the market and frying it to sell. Abena uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell. She will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua lives together with her husband who is a farmer and seven dependents at Asafora near the Cape Coast. Efua is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale.  Efua has been selling fried fish for 15 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband and feed and cloth their children.  Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.  Efua will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a fish monger.  She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale.  Abena has been selling fried fish for five years now.  She is married with five children.  She uses her income to support her husband and to feed and cloth their children.  Abena will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.  Abena will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Marije

texts.en:
Nazire is 36 years old and married.  She has two children: one is thirteen and the other is eleven years old. They all live in the northwest part of the country. She has studied dress making and fashion design and has been in business for the past three years renting a little tailoring shop.  She finds herself being busy and happy at the same time with the workload and says beaming, “It works just perfectly with me.” 
Considering the demand for her tailoring services, Nazire wants to expand her business by buying textile raw material. With the profit, she wants to invest in a good sized store.
She has been referred to the institutions from her relatives who are VisionFund’s Albania clients. She hopes that her wish of expanding her services will be fulfilled with the support from Kiva lenders and she thanks them in advance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for textiles.

loans.name: Lilean

texts.en: Lilean is a 24 year old married woman.  She has a son who is one years old.  She describes herself to be a social and a talkative woman.  She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services.  She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member.  Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are women.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent power outages . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a blowdrying machine.  Her business goal is to run many salon in her home town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with thegains from the business.

loans.use: to buy a blow drying machine.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.es: Jenifer es socia del Bancomunal Llamkasum, tiene 27 años de edad y es madre soltera de 1 hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y trabaja haciendo repostería, además cada sábado viaja a las ferias para traer cereales y venderlos en su distrito. Ella manifiesta que su experiencia en FINCA Perú ha sido muy buena ya que la apoyan cuando necesita dinero para invertir en su negocio y otras instituciones no le brindan las mismas facilidades. Su sueño para el futuro es brindarle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar su calidad de vida  así como la de su hija. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más cereales para vender como quinua, quiwicha, trigo.
texts.en: Jenifer is a member of the Llamkasum community bank.  She is 27 years old and the single mother of one daughter.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and works making confectionery.  In addition, every Saturday she travels to street markets to buy cereals which she then takes back home and sells in her district.  She says that her experience with FINCA Peru has been very good because they support her whenever she needs money to invest in her business and other institutions do not provide her with the same facilities.  Her dream for the future is to provide her daughter with a good education and improve her own quality of life as well as her daughter's.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying more cereals to sell such as quinoa, amaranth and wheat.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell (quinoa, amaranth and wheat)

loans.name: Pjeter

texts.en:
Pjeter is 48 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are still attending school. The oldest child is 22 and the youngest 17 years old. 

Pjeter has been running a dairy farm and animal sales business for 16 years so he has plenty of experience. This is his first time requesting a Kiva loan via VisionFund Albania. With this loan, he will purchase a cow with a calf, because he wants to expand his business since he has a steady clientele. With any profits, Pjeter will be able to save for reconstructing their current family house. Current VisionFund's Albania clients who have referred him to us comment on his responsible nature. Pjeter thanks potential lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow with a calf

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells doughnuts, which she has done for 5 years. Efua is married and has five children.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying for her children’s school fees.  Efua will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut-making business.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Elisa;la socia continua dedicandose a la compra y venta de ropa,como casacas, pantalones, chompas entre otros,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria vendiendo su mercaderia a sus amistades y familiares que le solicitan,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como casacas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank and lives in the district of Urcos, in the Quispicanchis province and the department of Cusco.
	
The member in question, Elisa, continues to work by buying and selling clothes such as jackets, trousers and jumpers among others. She works as a street vendor selling her merchandise to her friends and relatives who ask her for it. Elisa is a happy and responsible person with a keen desire to get ahead for her family. The member requests the loan to buy merchandise such as jackets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as jackets.

loans.name: Gladys Ender

texts.es: Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Hormigas, tiene 32 años de edad y es casada. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes. A través de su trabajo con la institución Gladys ha aprendido a administrar cuidadosamente su dinero e invertirlo en su negocio, a ser responsable y a pagar puntualmente sus préstamos.  Su sueño para el futuro es de tener una cadena de tiendas y de esa manera apoyar a su familia financieramente. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras, aceite, bebidas,etc.
texts.en: Gladus is a member of the Hormigas Community Bank. She is 32 years old and is married. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year and is the owner of a grocery shop. Through her work with the institution, Gladys has learned to manager her money carefully and invest it in her business, to be responsible and to pay her loans punctually. Her dream for the future is to have a chain of stores and, in this way, support her family financially. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries for her business like rice, sugar, noodles, beans, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business like rice, sugar, noodles, beans, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de pan, la socia lleva años ejerciendo este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria los panes ,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como harina y manteca.
texts.en: The member is Maritza. She continues with her business buying and selling bread. For years she has been working in this business which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it. The member sells bread on foot. She is a happy and responsible person with many wishes to continue working for her family. She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients for her business such as flour and butter.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as flour and butter.

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier is a skilled woodcarver who creates relief panels with religious themes. He would like to stock up on high quality raw materials.

Javier has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

Javier strives to continue his family's carving tradition. "It is a legacy we have inherited from our ancestors. I decided to go my own way as I wanted to work on my original designs. I have always enjoyed carving! I love the look of wood, its color and natural appearance. My brother taught me how to find the detail in every little corner. I joined my family when they were commissioned to work on a screen for the Church of the Assumption in my village. It meant a lot to each one of us."

"Woodcarving is my family's legacy. When I saw how my sculptures were well received and appreciated, I felt that God has placed me on the road to continue expressing myself through my work. This experience is a blessing for me, and you are a part of it."

Use the link below to view Javier's relief panels and carvings on the NOVICA site:http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5800

loans.use: to purchase high quality raw materials.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is an artisan who specializes in alpaca accessories including shawls, ponchos, hats and scarves. This is the time of the year when alpaca wool is readily available, and he would like to invest in large quantities so he can prepare a good stock of accessories for the upcoming high season.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is his story:

"When I was but a small child, I learned from my parents the best weaving techniques. Like me, they had learned from their own parents. This makes us a family entirely devoted to the world of textiles, and we have been for generations. Nowadays, I combine weaving by hand with the use of classic equipment, and have a special passion for traditional Inca and colonial motifs."

"From the moment I joined NOVICA I began to grow and grow as an artisan and as a person. And not only that, my designs and my work have also improved. I've created new designs and collections thanks to the unwavering support I've received. My workshop has grown and so has the team of people I work with, which is my way of supporting the people in my community -- especially the women who provide for their families. It fills me with great pride to know that I have achieved all of this with a product that is 100% Andean. I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for considering this microcredit request. You are supporting the preservation of our culture and tradition."

Use the link below to view Alfredo's work on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2891

loans.use: to stock up on wool ahead of the winter selling season.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a weaver who crafts tapestries and handbags using traditional Andean looms. He would like to invest in a professional-grade sewing machine to open up the possibility of developing new designs and finishes and expanding his business.

Walter has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Walter continues his family's weaving legacy in the style of San Pedro de Cajas. "My father was a well-known weaver who won several national prizes, and many of his finest works ended up in Europe. I began working with him when I was 14 years old. I am a full-time weaver of tapestries. My wife also weaves and we transmit the beauty and tradition of our hometown to the rest of the world. Our tapestries emulate photographs with their delicate shading of colors. The yarn is like paint, and my hands are like a paintbrush. Now I find I need new tools to create a different line of textiles. Thank you so much for your help."

Use the link below to view Walter's tapestries and handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=760

loans.use: to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem has taken a photograph together with her husband in front of their thatched house in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Nem is now 54 years old while her husband is one year older than her. Together, they have given birth to four children, one of whom started a new family and the other three children are single. Rice farming has been the primary source of income for Nem’s family. Nem cultivates rice for both their sustenance and for sale. Also, Nen has her husband, and some of her children, help in this business. Nem wants to make improvements in her business in order to satisfy her family’s living needs. She aims to become financially stable so that she will be able to provide all the basic necessities to this family.

As of now, Nem is requesting additional capital in the amount of USD 1,300, which will be used to purchase a motorcycle for home use. Also, with the remaining funds she will pay for labor costs occurred in transplanting her rice crops. She hopes to obtain the requested loan amount in order to develop her business as well as her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a funeral services business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and other supplies for her funeral services business.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. Gina earns additional income from raising livestock.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and other supplies for her funeral services business

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
EL socio pertence al banco comunal QORI ORCCO;el socio Teofilo tiene 60 años,casado y tiene 03 hijos;el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de multiservicios ,el vende diferentes tipos de productos de libreria,regalos,ropa entre otros,el socio es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,el socio trabaja todos los dias en su negocio desde las 09:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como chompas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofilo is a member of the communal bank QORI ORCCO. He is 60 years old, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his multiple service business. He sells different types of products, i.e. books, gifts, and clothing, among others. He is a happy and responsible person with lots of desire to continue working for his family. He works from approximately 9:00 am to 9:00 pm every day. This is how he helps his family to get ahead.
Teofilo is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise, such as sweaters, for his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as sweaters, for his business.

loans.name: Emma Gloria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pasto,en su negocio de teinda de abarrotes la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche y aceite y el pasto lo vende en las noches por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y ampliar el negocio de venta de pasto.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues dedicating herself to the grocery store business and also continues dedicating herself to the business of selling food. In her grocery store business, she sells rice, sugar, milk and oil and the food she sells at night. Through these businesses she is getting her children ahead. The member's dream is to expand the grocery store and food businesses. She is requesting the loan to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale prices.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Clara Agripina

texts.es:
Clara Agripina tiene 40 años de edad es soltera tiene cinco hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Clara Agripina se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de pollos, cerdos, patos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para la cría. Realiza sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de Babahoyo.

El sueño de la señora es contar con salud. El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a limpiar la casa.
texts.en: Clara Agripina is 40 years old. She is single and has five children. She lives in Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. It is located in the San Francisco zone. She belongs to the parish of San Juan de Pueblo Viejo. She is dedicated to farm work. Clara Agripina is dedicated to raising animals like hens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy chicken, pigs and ducks. With the support of the loan, she will be able to buy more animals to raise. She makes her purchases and sales in the city of Babahoyo. Her dream is to be healthy. The challenge that she faces it to keep working to get ahead. In her free time, she is dedicated to her animals and cleaning the house.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Yhely Hindira

texts.es: Yhely es socia del Bancomunal Hormigas, tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años, es estudiante de derecho y también se dedica a la venta de ropa, las vende en la universidad y también al público en general. Su sueño para el futuro es obtener su título universitario y ser profesional. El préstamo  que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para vender y  así continuar con el éxito de su negocio.
texts.en: Yhely is a member of the communal bank Hormigas. She is twenty-four years old and single. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She is a law student and also sells clothing. She sells clothing at the university and also to the general public. Her dream for the future is to earn a university degree and have a professional career. She will invest the loan she is requesting by purchasing clothing to sell and thereby keep her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Matilde Lucrecia

texts.es:
Matilde, una joven mujer de 39 años, oriunda de la ciudad de Latacunga ubicada en la provincia del Cotopaxi, en la sierra centro del Ecuador, ha solicitado por primera vez un crédito en Kiva para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para su negocio.

La ciudad de Latacunga está ubicada en la zona interandina el Ecuador, tiene clima templado y gracias a que se encuentra en el centro del país ha tenido un gran crecimiento económico y constructivo, que es precisamente el ámbito del negocio de Matilde. La provincia de Cotopaxi al estar atravesada por la carretera Panamericana, una vía de primer orden, es una zona de gran intercambio comercial, sobretodo de la enorme cantidad de productos agrícolas que ahí se cultivan.

Matilde tiene hace 12 años un pequeño negocio de venta de cementina en fundas; la cementina es un material de construcción que se usa para blanqueamiento y alisado de paredes. Aprendió de su padre los secretos del negocio y a pesar de tener muchas dificultades como la separación de su esposo y un inesperado gasto médico, estos años de experiencia le han servido para sustentar sola a sus 5 hijos.

Matilde una mujer con tan solo educación primaria, trabaja alrededor de 5 horas diarias en su negocio, sin contar con todo el tiempo que destina al cuidado, educación y sustento de sus hijos. Ella tiene dificultades para acceder a los bancos tradicionales, y necesita el crédito para incrementar el negocio en que ya tiene mucha experiencia, comprando una mayor cantidad de materia prima, lo cual le permitirá conseguir mayores ganancias que destinará a la educación de sus hijos y a lograr un mayor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Matilde, a young 39 year old woman, a native of the city of Latacunga, located in the province of Cotopaxi, in the central mountains of Ecuador, has requested for the first time a loan from Kiva to be able to buy a greater quantity of raw material for her business.

The city of Latacunga is located in the inter-Andes zone of Ecuador. It has a temperate climate and, thanks to being found in the center of the country, has had a great economic and construction growth, which is precisely the scope of Matilde's work. The province of Cotopaxi, crossed by the Panamerican highway, a first order road, is an area of much commercial exchange, above all the enormous quantity of farming products that they cultivate there.

Matilde has had for twelve years a small business selling cement in cases. The cement is a construction material that is used in bleaching and straightening walls. She learned the secrets of the business from her father and despite having many difficulties like the separating from her husband and an unexpected medical expense, those years of experience have served her to support her five children on her own.

Matilde is a woman with only elementary school education. She works around five hours daily in her business, without counting the time spent caring for, educating and supporting her children. She has difficulty approaching traditional banks and needs the loan to increase the business in which she already has a lot of experience, buying a greater quantity of raw material which will allow her to get greater earnings that are destined for the education of her children and to achieve a better wellbeing for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende en el mercado y tambien la socia sigue teniendo una tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras y tambien comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonia continues to sell food in the market, and in her corner store she sells basics such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8 am to 10 pm. With income from these two small businesses, she helps her children get ahead. Her dream is to grow her market and store businesses.

Antonia is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as chicken, meat, and vegetables, as well as stock for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil at wholesale prices.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat, and vegetables, and stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a food café which has been in operation for three years. From this café, Josephine sells tea, cooked cereals and bread. Kabibi began the business from her savings.

Kabibi was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more tables and chairs for the café. 

Kabibi’s aspiration is to own a fully stocked restaurant in the near future and the additional income will help her expand her menu by offering different varieties of food.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs for the café.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Helen has requested a 4100 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Helen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will not only be saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid for 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from charcoal retail, pig fattening, motorcycle transport and farming rice.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 55 years old and married with three children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business doing direct sales of Avon in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of Avon for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Judith aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lorgen

texts.en:
Lorgen is 46 years old, married, with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorgen has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Lorgen requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Lorgen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lorgen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old, married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance.

Maribel has been in this business for one year. In the future, Maribel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: C18539 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Sylvie is 41 years old and is married with three children aged between 11 and 13 years old and she takes care of one relative who is 10 years old. She sells various goods such as bananas, beans, potatoes, maize, etc. Vestine is a leader of this group, which is called "C18539 URUKUNDO" in the local language, which means in English "LOVE". In the photo, she's the one who is in front of the others. She works from 7 a.m to 10 p.m daily except on Sunday. Sylvie has 17 years of experience in this work and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Sylvie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various food such as beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. for re-sale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various food such as beans, potatoes, bananas, maize, etc. for re-sale.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmela ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de librería, ella vende artículos de escritorio y también vende útiles escolares como lápices, cuadernos, libros entre otros utiles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros y borradores.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de desayunos, negocio de restaurant y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is the “SANTO DOMINGO” communal bank group. This group is located in the district of Urubamba, in the Urubamba province and the Cusco department.

Carmela is 40 years old. She is single and has two children. She works at her book store. She sells writing implements, as well as school supplies such as pencils, notebooks, and books, among other items. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through her business she has been able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her book store. She is requesting the loan to purchase books, notebooks, mechanical pencils, and erasers.
The other members of the group sell beauty products, breakfast items, restaurant goods, and food.

Carmela is grateful to everyone who helps her achieve her dreams through the communal bank. She promises to make her loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase books, notebooks, mechanical pencils, and erasers.

loans.name: Luz Mariana

texts.es:
LUZ MARIANA tiene 53 años es casada, tiene 10 hijos Vive con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC 3 cruces esta ventanilla se dedica al cultivo de cacao, naranja y maíz.

LUZ MARIANA se dedica a la siembra de cacao. Solicita el crédito para compra de urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes, líquido para la maleza.

Con el apoyo del crédito piensa comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hace.

Realiza sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de Montalvo cada semana.
El sueño de la señora es comprar un carro.
El desafío al que se enfrenta es las plagas en los cultivos.
En su tiempo libre trabaja y sale a pasear.
texts.en:
Luz Mariana is 53 years old and married.  She has ten children and lives with her husband and children in the city of Montalvo in the province of Los Rios.  

She is a member of the solidarity group "Three Crosses".  This group works in the cultivation of cacao, oranges and corn.  

Luz Mariana grows cacao.  She is requesting this loan to buy urea, insecticides, fertilizers and weed killers.  With the help of the loan she plans to buy the fertilizers that she needs very much.  She completes her purchases in the city of Montalvo each week.

Her dream is to buy a car.  Her challenge is the pests on the crops.  

In her free time she works and goes out to walk.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 36 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school, so Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her store. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, sugar and toothpaste. 

In the future Melba would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Nermilyn

texts.en:
Nermilyn is 25 years old and married with one child.  

Nermilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nermilyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, toothpaste, soap, canned goods, spices, etc.. 

In the future Nermilyn  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 51 years old and married with 10 children. With two children in school, Purita works very hard to provide for them.

Purita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Purita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, egg, spices, sugar, etc.. 

In the future Purita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 36 years old and married with four children.

Rica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Rica has borrowed and paid for nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Rica aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 63 years old and married with five children.

Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Estelita has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 42 years and also earns an income from a barbershop.

Estelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem is a hard-working mother who is engaged in a grocery selling business to generate income. She sells soft drinks, chocolates, sweets, shampoos, canned goods, and spices to serve people around her community. She is thankful to her customers who are buying and using her products, this allows her to provide enough food for the family and pay tuition fees for her children. Hem has been in this business for four years and earns approximately USD 3.50 per day on average. She is now 54 years old and has three children.

Hem aims to improve her selling business and increase her merchandise to satisfy her customers. That’s why she is asking for an additional capital of USD 700 to purchase noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, biscuits, and beauty products to sell in her store. She believes that the loan will help them to improve the business well. With the profit she will earn, Hem will continue supporting the education of her children because she wants them to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, biscuits, and beauty products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married with two children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid for three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is 37 years old and married with three children.

Melda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail and nipa (woven palm mats) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Melda has borrowed and paid for 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail and nipa (woven palm mats) business for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Candida works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Candida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Candida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Sofanor Gustavo

texts.es: Sofanor cuando recibió su anterior credikiva compró una estufa, maíz, aceite pollo carne frutos e insumos con los cuales elaboró pasabocas fritos con sus respectivos refrescos y ganó un poco mas de dinero de lo acostumbrado, porque incrementó su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva,  con el que comprará implementos como calderos, cucharones y molinos, además comprará víveres para volver a invertir en materias primas en mayor volumen y una gran proporción en refrescos. Con esta inversión aumentará su cartera de clientes y también sus ventas, lo cual lo pone contento porque repuntan sus ingresos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por su apoyo tuve dificultades pues se dañó mi  enfriador afortunadamente logré superar esta situación y terminé de cancelar mi crédito; espero me continúen apoyando para continuar fortaleciendo mi negocio”.
texts.en: When Sofanor received his previous Kiva loan, he purchased a stove, corn, oil, chicken, beef, fruit, and ingredients, which he used to make fried snacks that he sold along with his soft drinks to earn a little more money than normal, which increased his working capital. Currently, he is applying for a new Kiva loan, which he will use to purchase implements such as cooking pots, ladles, and grinders. Additionally, he will purchase supplies so he can invest in a greater quantity of raw materials and a larger number of soft drinks. With this investment, he will improve his customer base, as well as his sales. Sofanor will be happy because his earnings will improve. His message to Kiva financiers is: “Thank you very much for your support. I had difficulties when my cooler was damaged, but luckily, I managed to overcome that situation and repay my loan. I hope that you will continue to support me so I can continue to strengthen my business.”

loans.use: to purchase implements such as cooking pots, ladles, and grinders, as well as supplies.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 56 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Consolacion works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Consolacion has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sardines, bread, spices, egg, noodles, etc.
